Taiwins

Global Namespace¶

Overview¶

// typedefs

typedef int (*shell_widget_draw_label_t)(
    struct shell_widget *,
    struct shell_widget_label *
    );

typedef int (*shell_widget_setup_cb_t)(struct shell_widget *);

typedef int (*shell_widget_path_find_t)(
    struct shell_widget *,
    char *path
    );

typedef bool (*tw_key_binding)(
    struct tw_keyboard *keyboard,
    uint32_t time,
    uint32_t key,
    uint32_t mods,
    uint32_t option,
    void *data
    );

typedef bool (*tw_btn_binding)(
    struct tw_pointer *pointer,
    uint32_t time_msec,
    uint32_t btn,
    uint32_t mods,
    void *data
    );

typedef bool (*tw_axis_binding)(
    struct tw_pointer *pointer,
    uint32_t time,
    double delta,
    enum wl_pointer_axis direction,
    uint32_t mods,
    void *data
    );

typedef bool (*tw_touch_binding)(
    struct tw_touch *touch,
    uint32_t time,
    uint32_t mods,
    void *data
    );

typedef void (*tw_xdg_layout_fun_t)(
    const enum tw_xdg_layout_command command,
    const struct tw_xdg_layout_op *arg,
    struct tw_xdg_view *v,
    struct tw_xdg_layout *l,
    struct tw_xdg_layout_op *ops
    );

typedef void (*tw_surface_commit_cb_t)(struct tw_surface *surface);

typedef hash_cmp_val (*hash_cmp_func_t)(
    const void *a,
    const void *intable
    );

typedef uint64_t (*hash_func_t)(const void *addr);
typedef struct dhash_table dhashtab_t;

typedef hash_cmp_val (*hash_cmp_func_t)(
    const void *a,
    const void *intable
    );

typedef uint64_t (*hash_func_t)(const void *addr);
typedef struct dhash_table dhashtab_t;

typedef int (*cmpfun)(
    const void *elemAddr1,
    const void *elemAddr2
    );

typedef void (*freefun)(void *elemAddr);

typedef void (*VecMapF)(
    void *elemAddr,
    void *auxData
    );

typedef int (*cmpfun)(
    const void *elemAddr1,
    const void *elemAddr2
    );

typedef void (*freefun)(void *elemAddr);

typedef void (*VecMapF)(
    void *elemAddr,
    void *auxData
    );

typedef struct list_t list_t;
typedef struct list_t list_t;
typedef struct radix_node radix_node_t;
typedef struct radix radix_t;
typedef struct radix_stack radix_stack_t;
typedef int (*radix_node_cb_t)(radix_node_t **noderef);
typedef struct radix_iterator radix_iterator_t;
typedef struct radix_node radix_node_t;
typedef struct radix radix_t;
typedef struct radix_stack radix_stack_t;
typedef int (*radix_node_cb_t)(radix_node_t **noderef);
typedef struct radix_iterator radix_iterator_t;

typedef void (*tdbus_logger_fn)(
    enum tdbus_log_level level,
    const char *fmt,
    va_list ap
    );

typedef int (*tdbus_read_signal_f)(const struct tdbus_signal *);
typedef int (*tdbus_read_call_f)(const struct tdbus_method_call *);
typedef int (*tdbus_read_reply_f)(const struct tdbus_reply *);

typedef void (*tdbus_add_watch_f)(
    void *user_data,
    int unix_fd,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    uint32_t mask,
    void *watch_data
    );

typedef void (*tdbus_ch_watch_f)(
    void *user_data,
    int unix_fd,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    uint32_t mask,
    void *watch_data
    );

typedef void (*tdbus_rm_watch_f)(
    void *user_data,
    int unix_fd,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    void *watch_data
    );

typedef void (*tdbus_add_timeout_f)(
    void *user_data,
    int interval,
    bool enable,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    void *timeout_data
    );

typedef void (*tdbus_ch_timeout_f)(
    void *user_data,
    int interval,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    void *timeout_data
    );

typedef void (*tdbus_rm_timeout_f)(
    void *user_data,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    void *timeout_data
    );

typedef const char* app_mime[TW_MIME_TYPE_MAX];

typedef void (*frame_t)(
    struct tw_appsurf *,
    const struct tw_app_event *e
    );

typedef void (*tw_shm_buffer_draw_t)(
    struct tw_appsurf *surf,
    struct wl_buffer *buffer,
    struct tw_bbox *geo
    );

typedef void (*tw_eglwin_draw_t)(
    struct tw_appsurf *surf,
    struct tw_bbox *geo
    );

typedef void (*nk_wl_drawcall_t)(
    struct nk_context *ctx,
    float width,
    float height,
    struct tw_appsurf *app
    );

typedef void (*nk_cairo_op)(
    cairo_t *cr,
    const struct nk_command *cmd
    );

typedef unsigned char nk_max_cmd_t[NK_MAX_CMD_SIZE];

static struct tw_app_event_filter console_key_filter = {     .intercept = suspend_console_on_esc,    .type = TW_KEY_BTN,    .link.prev =&console_key_filter.link,   .link.next =&console_key_filter.link, };
struct taiwins_console_listener console_impl = {   .application_configure = update_app_config,     .start = start_console,     .exec = exec_application, };
static const struct taiwins_theme_listener theme_impl = {  .theme = console_apply_theme,   .cursor = console_apply_cursor, };
static struct wl_registry_listener registry_listener = {   .global = announce_globals,     .global_remove = announce_global_remove };

struct console_module cmd_module = {  .name = "MODULE_CMD",   .filter_test = console_cmd_module_filter_test,  .exec = console_cmd_module_exec,    .search = console_cmd_module_search,    .init_hook = console_cmd_module_init,   .destroy_hook = console_cmd_module_destroy,     .supported_icons = CONSOLE_ICON_MIME,    .support_cache = true, };

static const GLchar quad_vs[] =  "uniform mat3 proj;\n"  "uniform vec4 color;\n"     "attribute vec2 pos;\n"     "attribute vec2 texcoord;\n"    "varying vec4 o_color;\n"   "varying vec2 o_texcoord;\n"    "\n"    "void main() {\n"   "   gl_Position = vec4(proj* vec3(pos, 1.0), 1.0);\n"   "   o_color = color;\n"     "   o_texcoord = texcoord;\n"   "}\n";
static const GLchar color_quad_fs[] =    "precision mediump float;\n"    "uniform float alpha;\n"    "varying vec4 o_color;\n"   "varying vec2 o_texcoord;\n"    "\n"    "void main() {\n"   "   gl_FragColor = o_color* alpha;\n"   "}\n"   "\n";
static const GLchar tex_quad_fs[] =  "precision mediump float;\n"    "uniform float alpha;\n"    "uniform sampler2D tex;\n"  "varying vec4 o_color;\n"   "varying vec2 o_texcoord;\n"    "\n"    "void main() {\n"   "   gl_FragColor = texture2D(tex, o_texcoord)* alpha;\n"    "}\n"   "\n";
const GLchar tex_quad_ext_fs[] =     "#extension GL_OES_EGL_image_external : require\n\n"    "precision mediump float;\n"    "varying vec4 o_color;\n"   "varying vec2 o_texcoord;\n"    "uniform samplerExternalOES tex;\n"     "uniform float alpha;\n"    "\n"    "void main() {\n"   "   gl_FragColor = texture2D(tex, o_texcoord)* alpha;\n"    "}\n";

static const DBusObjectPathVTable server_vtable = {     .message_function = tdbus_server_handle_method,     .unregister_function = tdbus_server_unregister, };
static const struct wl_callback_listener tw_appsurf_wl_frame_impl = {     .done = tw_appsurf_frame_done, };
static const struct wl_callback_listener tw_appsurf_frame_event_impl = {  .done = tw_appsurf_run_frame_event, };
static struct wl_shm_listener shm_listener = {     shm_format };
static struct wl_seat_listener seat_listener = {   .capabilities = seat_capabilities,  .name = seat_name, };
static struct wl_data_offer_listener data_offer_listener = {   .offer = data_offer_offered,    .source_actions = data_offer_source_actions,    .action = data_offer_action, };
static struct wl_data_device_listener data_device_listener = {     .data_offer = data_offer,   .enter = data_enter,    .leave = data_leave,    .motion = data_motion,  .drop = data_drop,  .selection = data_selection, };
static struct udev* UDEV = NULL;
static struct wl_keyboard_listener keyboard_listener = {     .key = handle_key,  .modifiers = handle_modifiers,  .enter = handle_keyboard_enter,     .leave = handle_keyboard_leave,     .keymap = handle_keymap,    .repeat_info = handle_repeat_info,  };
static struct wl_pointer_listener pointer_listener = {0};
static struct wl_touch_listener touch_listener = {    .down = handle_touch_down,  .up = handle_touch_up,  .motion = handle_touch_motion,  .frame = handle_touch_frame,    .cancel = handle_touch_cancel,  .shape = handle_touch_shape,    .orientation = handle_touch_orientation, };
struct nk_wl_ftlib NK_WL_FTLIB = {0};
static const nk_cairo_op nk_cairo_ops[] = {    nk_cairo_noop,  nk_cairo_scissor,   nk_cairo_line,  nk_cairo_curve,     nk_cairo_rect,  nk_cairo_rect_filled,   nk_cairo_rect_multi_color,  nk_cairo_circle,    nk_cairo_circle_filled,     nk_cairo_arc,   nk_cairo_arc_filled,    nk_cairo_triangle,  nk_cairo_triangle_filled,   nk_cairo_polygon,   nk_cairo_polygon_filled,    nk_cairo_polyline,  nk_cairo_text,  nk_cairo_image,     nk_cairo_custom, };
static const struct nk_draw_vertex_layout_element vertex_layout[] = {     {NK_VERTEX_POSITION, NK_FORMAT_FLOAT,    NK_OFFSETOF(struct nk_egl_vertex, position)},   {NK_VERTEX_TEXCOORD, NK_FORMAT_FLOAT,    NK_OFFSETOF(struct nk_egl_vertex, uv)},     {NK_VERTEX_COLOR, NK_FORMAT_R8G8B8A8,    NK_OFFSETOF(struct nk_egl_vertex, col)},    {NK_VERTEX_LAYOUT_END} };
static const struct nk_egl_backend* CURRENT_CONTEXT = NULL;
static EGLSurface CURRENT_SURFACE = NULL;
static const GLchar* glsl_vs =    GL_SHADER_VERSION    "uniform mat4 ProjMtx;\n"   "in vec2 Position;\n"   "in vec2 TexCoord;\n"   "in vec4 Color;\n"  "out vec2 Frag_UV;\n"   "out vec4 Frag_Color;\n"    "void main() {\n"   "   Frag_UV = TexCoord;\n"  "   Frag_Color = Color;\n"  "   gl_Position = ProjMtx* vec4(Position.xy, 0, 1);\n"  "}\n";
static const GLchar* glsl_fs =    GL_SHADER_VERSION    "precision mediump float;\n"    "uniform sampler2D Texture;\n"  "in vec2 Frag_UV;\n"    "in vec4 Frag_Color;\n"     "out vec4 Out_Color;\n"     "void main(){\n"    "   Out_Color = Frag_Color* texture(Texture, Frag_UV.st);\n"    "}\n";
static const GLchar* gles_vs =    GLES_SHADER_VERSION  "uniform mat4 ProjMtx;\n"   "attribute vec2 Position;\n"    "attribute vec2 TexCoord;\n"    "attribute vec4 Color;\n"   "varying vec2 Frag_UV;\n"   "varying vec4 Frag_Color;\n"    "void main() {\n"   "   Frag_UV = TexCoord;\n"  "   Frag_Color = Color;\n"  "   gl_Position = ProjMtx* vec4(Position.xy, 0, 1);\n"  "}\n";
static const GLchar* gles_fs =    GLES_SHADER_VERSION  "precision mediump float;\n"    "uniform sampler2D Texture;\n"  "varying vec2 Frag_UV;\n"   "varying vec4 Frag_Color;\n"    "void main(){\n"    "   gl_FragColor = Frag_Color* texture2D(Texture, Frag_UV.st);\n"   "}\n";
static struct nk_wl_font_config default_config = {   .name = "sans",     .slant = NK_WL_SLANT_ROMAN,    .pix_size = 16,     .scale = 1,   .nranges = 0,   .ranges = NULL,     .TTFonly = false, };

    struct tw_xdg_layout* l,
    struct tw_xdg_layout_op* ops
    );

    const struct tw_xdg_layout_op* arg,
    struct tw_xdg_view* v,
    struct tw_xdg_layout* l,
    struct tw_xdg_layout_op* ops
    );

    const struct tw_xdg_layout_op* arg,
    struct tw_xdg_view* v,

    );

    struct tw_workspace* w,
    struct tw_xdg_view* v,
    double dx,
    double dy
    );

    struct tw_workspace* w,

    double dx,

    enum wl_shell_surface_resize edge
    );

    );

    char* model,
    enum wl_output_subpixel subpixel,
    enum wl_output_transform transform
    );

    );

    struct tw_vec3* dst,

    const struct tw_vec3* b
    );

bool tw_mat4_inverse(struct tw_mat4* dst, const struct tw_mat4* src);

    struct tw_mat4* dst,
    const struct tw_mat4* a,
    const struct tw_mat4* b
    );

    struct tw_vec3* r,
    const struct tw_mat4* m,
    const struct tw_vec3* v
    );

    struct tw_vec3* r,
    const struct tw_mat4* m,
    const struct tw_vec3* v
    );

    struct tw_mat4* dst,
    float xy_degree,
    float xz_degree,
    float yz_degree
    );

    struct tw_mat4* dst,
    const struct tw_vec3* center,
    const struct tw_vec3* target,
    const struct tw_vec3* up
    );

    struct tw_mat4* dst,
    float left,
    float right,
    float bottom,
    float top,
    float near,
    float far
    );

    struct tw_mat4* dst,
    float left,
    float right,
    float bottom,
    float top,
    float near,
    float far
    );

    struct tw_mat4* dst,
    float fovy,
    float aspect,
    float near,
    float far
    );

    enum TW_LOG_LEVEL level,
    const char* format,
    va_list ap
    );

static float deg2rad(float degree);
static enum wl_output_transform transform_ydown_from_yup(enum wl_output_transform t);
WL_EXPORT void tw_mat3_init(struct tw_mat3* mat);

    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    const struct tw_mat3* a,
    const struct tw_mat3* b
    );

    const struct tw_mat3* mat,
    float x,
    float y,
    float* rx,
    float* ry
    );

    const struct tw_mat3* mat,
    pixman_box32_t* dst,
    const pixman_box32_t* src
    );

WL_EXPORT void tw_mat3_region_transform(
    const struct tw_mat3* mat,
    pixman_region32_t* dst,
    pixman_region32_t* src
    );

WL_EXPORT void tw_mat3_scale(struct tw_mat3* dst, float x, float y);

    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    enum wl_output_transform transform,
    bool yup
    );

    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    bool yup,
    enum wl_output_transform transform,
    uint32_t width,
    uint32_t height,
    uint32_t scale
    );

    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    uint32_t width,
    uint32_t height
    );

void tdbus_msg_free_array(void* array, unsigned count, enum tdbus_arg_type type);

void _tdbus_message_itr_init(
    struct _tdbus_message_itr* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_arg* value
    );

TDBUS_EXPORT struct tdbus_message_itr* tdbus_msg_itr_new(void);
TDBUS_EXPORT void tdbus_msg_itr_done(struct tdbus_message_itr* itr);

void tdbus_reader_from_message(
    DBusMessage* message,
    struct tdbus_signal* signal,
    struct tdbus_method_call* call,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply
    );

static void tdbus_notify_reply(DBusPendingCall* pending, void* user_data);

TDBUS_EXPORT struct tdbus_message* tdbus_call_method(
    const char* dest,
    const char* path,
    const char* interface,
    const char* method,
    tdbus_read_reply_f reply,
    void* user_data
    );

    const struct tdbus_message* reply_to,
    const char* err_name
    );

    struct tdbus* bus,
    struct tdbus_message* bus_msg
    );

    struct tdbus* bus,
    struct tdbus_message* bus_msg,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply
    );

    struct tdbus* bus,
    const char* dest,
    const char* path,
    const char* interface,
    const char* method,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply,
    const char* fmt,
    ...
    );

TDBUS_EXPORT void tdbus_free_message(struct tdbus_message* bus_msg);

    struct _tdbus_message_itr* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_arg* value
    );

static enum tdbus_arg_type tdbus_arg_type_from_dbus(int dbus_type);
static int tdbus_arg_type_to_dbus(enum tdbus_arg_type type);
static size_t tdbus_get_msg_arg_size(enum tdbus_arg_type type);
static bool tdbus_type_is_string(enum tdbus_arg_type type);
static bool tdbus_type_is_object(enum tdbus_arg_type type);
static bool tdbus_type_is_dict_entry(enum tdbus_arg_type type);
static bool tdbus_type_is_fixed(enum tdbus_arg_type type);

    DBusSignatureIter* sitr,
    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr
    );

    struct tdbus_message_itr* itr,
    int dbus_type
    );

    struct tdbus_message_itr* itr,
    enum tdbus_arg_type type,
    int count
    );

    union tdbus_arg_value* dst,
    int type,
    const DBusBasicValue* src
    );

    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_arg* arg
    );

    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_arg_dict_entry* entry
    );

    DBusSignatureIter* sitr,
    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr
    );

    DBusSignatureIter* sitr,
    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr
    );

    DBusSignatureIter* sitr,
    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr
    );

    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr
    );

    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr

    struct tw_appsurf* app,
    struct wl_shell_surface* protocol
    );

static void nk_wl_impl_xdg_configure(
    void* data,
    struct xdg_toplevel* xdg_toplevel,
    int32_t width,
    int32_t height,
    struct wl_array* states
    );

    void* data,
    struct xdg_toplevel* xdg_toplevel
    );

WL_EXPORT void nk_wl_impl_xdg_toplevel(
    struct tw_appsurf* app,
    struct xdg_toplevel* toplevel
    );

static struct nk_vec2 nk_vec2_from_tw(const tw_vec2_t* vec);

    const struct tw_style_item* item,
    const struct nk_image* image_pool
    );

struct image_cache nk_wl_build_theme_images(struct tw_theme* theme);

    struct nk_style_button* button,
    const struct tw_style_button* src_button,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_toggle* src_toggle,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_selectable* src_select,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_slider* src_slider,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_progress* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_scrollbar* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_edit* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_property* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_chart* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    const struct tw_style_combo* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    );

    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    struct nk_style_window* style,
    const struct tw_style_window* src_style,
    const struct nk_image* images
    );

    struct image_cache* cache,
    struct nk_wl_backend* b
    );

    struct nk_wl_backend* b,
    const struct tw_theme* theme
    );

Detailed Documentation¶

Typedefs¶

typedef struct list_t list_t

double-link list I guess this one you have one head extra which is just head

typedef struct list_t list_t

double-link list I guess this one you have one head extra which is just head

typedef void (*tdbus_add_watch_f)(
    void *user_data,
    int unix_fd,
    struct tdbus *bus,
    uint32_t mask,
    void *watch_data
    )

dbus watchers

typedef void (*tw_shm_buffer_draw_t)(
    struct tw_appsurf *surf,
    struct wl_buffer *buffer,
    struct tw_bbox *geo
    )

one of the implementation of tw_appsurf

In this case, the user_data is taken and used for callback, so we do not need to allocate new memory, since you won’t have extra space for ther other user_data, expecting to embend tw_appsurf in another data structure.

Global Functions¶

static void console_draw(
    struct nk_context* ctx,
    float width,
    float height,
    struct tw_appsurf* surf
    )

draw the console application

struct nk_wl_backend* desktop_console_aquire_nk_backend(struct desktop_console* console)

public console data shared by console modules

struct nk_wl_backend* desktop_console_aquire_nk_backend(struct desktop_console* console)

public console data shared by console modules

static void xdg_app_module_update_icons(struct console_module* module)

update the desktop_entry icons with cache

create a hash search table first, then go through all the xdg_app_entrys, if it does not hav a icon, try to update with this cache.

static bool console_cmd_module_filter_test(
    const char* command,
    const char* candidate
    )

command search is based on the first word

static bool console_module_get_name(lua_State* L, int pos, char module_name[32])

test for valid name and no exisinting module with same name

static int console_module_from_lua_table(lua_State* L, int pos)

load a lua console module from table,

this method takes a table on the pos then create a console_module_for it.

static int console_module_from_lua_file(lua_State* L, const char* module)

load a lua console module from script, as opposed to console_module_from_lua_table

void* thread_run_module(void* arg)

running thread for the module,

module thread is a consumer for commands and producer for results. If the results is not taken, it needs to clean up before do it again.

Console thread does the reverse. It is the consumer of results and producer of commands, if the commands it produced is not taken, it needs to reset it manually.

We have a general cache method to reduce the uncessary module searching.

static void launch_shell_widget(
    struct wl_client* client,
    struct wl_resource* resource,
    uint32_t tw_ui,
    struct wl_resource* wl_surface,
    struct wl_resource* wl_seat,
    int32_t idx,
    uint32_t x,
    uint32_t y
    )

I should have a seat on it

static int conversation(
    int num_msg,
    const struct pam_message** msgs,
    struct pam_response** resp,
    void* appdata_ptr
    )

This function performs a conversation between our application and and the module. It receives an array of messages in the parameters (set by the module) and sets the array of responses in the parameters with the appropriate content. For example if the module calls this function with a message “login:” we are expected to set the firs response with the username.

Parameters:

num_msg

Number of messages from the module

msg

Array of messages (set by the module, should not be modified)

resp

Array of responses this function must set

appdata_ptr

Pointer to additional data. The pointer received is that specified in the pam_conv structure below.

 
static bool _lua_parse_menu(struct lua_State* L, vector_t* menus)

parse_menu from -1

static int _lua_register_widget(lua_State* L)

users call this function to register a widget,

example:

twwidget.new_widget({ name = “my widget”, anchor = function })

or then can: w = twwidgets.new_widget() w:anchor(‘asdfaf’) w:set… w:register()

or twwidgets.add_builtin_widget(‘clock’)

struct tw_bindings* tw_bindings_create(struct wl_display* display)

tw_bindings is used in configurations, used by configuration. User would swap to new binding system in run-time.

void tw_bindings_move(struct tw_bindings* dst, struct tw_bindings* src)

ability to move assign src bindings to dst, so we can avoid deleting all the bindings.

struct tw_binding_node* tw_binding_node_step(
    struct tw_binding_node* tree,
    uint32_t keycode,
    uint32_t mod_mask
    )

search sub keystate in the keystate

bool tw_bindings_add_key(
    struct tw_bindings* root,
    const struct tw_key_press presses[MAX_KEY_SEQ_LEN],
    const tw_key_binding func,
    uint32_t option,
    void* data
    )

add_key_bindings

going through the tree structure to add leaves. We are taking the considerration of collisions, this is IMPORTANT because we can only activate one grab at a time.

If there are collisions, the keybinding is not not added to the system.

struct tw_bindings* tw_bindings_create(struct wl_display* display)

tw_bindings is used in configurations, used by configuration. User would swap to new binding system in run-time.

void tw_bindings_move(struct tw_bindings* dst, struct tw_bindings* src)

ability to move assign src bindings to dst, so we can avoid deleting all the bindings.

bool tw_bindings_add_key(
    struct tw_bindings* root,
    const struct tw_key_press presses[MAX_KEY_SEQ_LEN],
    const tw_key_binding binding,
    uint32_t option,
    void* data
    )

add_key_bindings

going through the tree structure to add leaves. We are taking the considerration of collisions, this is IMPORTANT because we can only activate one grab at a time.

If there are collisions, the keybinding is not not added to the system.

struct tw_binding_node* tw_binding_node_step(
    struct tw_binding_node* keystate,
    uint32_t keycode,
    uint32_t mod_mask
    )

search sub keystate in the keystate

static void tw_config_apply_table(
    struct tw_config* config,
    struct tw_config_table* src
    )

swap config like move assignment.

at this point we know for sure we can apply the config. This works even if our dst is a fresh new config. The release function will take care of freeing things,

bool tw_config_run(struct tw_config* config, char** err_msg)

run/rerun the configurations.

The configuration runs in protective mode. We create a temporary configuration and run config script within. If everything is indeed fine. We will migrate to the main config.

bool tw_config_run(struct tw_config* config, char** err_msg)

run/rerun the configurations.

The configuration runs in protective mode. We create a temporary configuration and run config script within. If everything is indeed fine. We will migrate to the main config.

modify the view state to be focused or not.

getting a xdg surface from tw_surface

bool tw_workspace_focus_view(struct tw_workspace* ws, struct tw_xdg_view* v)

move view to the front in the workspace.

This action is different than tw_xdg_view_set_focus, which will only change the view state.

void tw_xdg_view_set_focus(struct tw_xdg_view* view, bool focus)

modify the view state to be focused or not.

bool tw_workspace_focus_view(struct tw_workspace* ws, struct tw_xdg_view* v)

move view to the front in the workspace.

This action is different than tw_xdg_view_set_focus, which will only change the view state.

struct tw_xdg_view* tw_xdg_view_from_tw_surface(struct tw_surface* surface)

getting a xdg surface from tw_surface

struct tw_desktop_surface* tw_xwayland_desktop_surface_from_tw_surface(struct tw_surface* surface)

xwayland surface is disgusted as a desktop surface for providing unified APIs,

struct tw_output_device_mode* tw_output_device_match_mode(
    struct tw_output_device* device,
    int width,
    int height,
    int refresh
    )

used by backends to extract potential matched mode

The algorithm would go through the mode_list searching for the closest mode available(unless there is no modes at all). We return on finding exact mode or the closest mode we can get.

void tw_output_device_raw_resolution(
    const struct tw_output_device* device,
    unsigned* width,
    unsigned* height
    )

get raw resolution, without scale or transform

void tw_output_device_loc_to_global(
    const struct tw_output_device* device,
    float x,
    float y,
    float* gx,
    float* gy
    )

mapping (0…1) in the output to global position

void tw_input_device_attach_emitter(
    struct tw_input_device* device,
    struct tw_input_source* emitter
    )

attach the given input device to an emitter.

multiple input devices can attach to the same emitter, the emitter can also be subscribed by multiple tw_input_sink. This way tw_input_device can handle many-sources-to-many-dests dependency.

struct tw_desktop_surface* tw_desktop_surface_from_tw_surface(struct tw_surface* surface)

getting the desktop surface from tw_surface

This function checks if tw_surface is a wl_shell_surface or xdg_surface, returned surface could be a toplevel, transient or a popup, additional check needs to be done.

EGLDeviceEXT tw_egl_device_from_path(const char* path)

EGL Stream APIs, not guarantee to exit

static int tw_log_level(enum TW_LOG_LEVEL level, const char* format, ...)

logging at info level.

void tw_mat3_wl_transform(
    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    enum wl_output_transform transform,
    bool yup
    )

rotate by wl_transform

Parameters:

yup

is true for x-right, y-up coordinates system, OpenGL uses this system, where bottom-left is the origin. yup is false for x-right, y-down coordinates system, wayland coordinates system uses this coordinates, where top-left is the origin.

 
void tw_mat3_transform_rect(
    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    bool yup,
    enum wl_output_transform transform,
    uint32_t width,
    uint32_t height,
    uint32_t scale
    )

@breif transform a (0, 0, width, height) by its size

the (width, height) here is needed to move the rect back to origin after multiplied by rotation and scaling matrix

void tw_mat3_ortho_proj(struct tw_mat3* dst, uint32_t width, uint32_t height)

generating matrix mapping coordinates from image space to clip space.

The mapping procedure goes as following:

(0, 0, width, height) –> (-1, -1, 1, 1) xp = 2*x/width - 1.0 yp = 2*y/height - 1.0

We take the image space coordiantes(in the wl_transformed output), which the origin is the top-left cornor. We need to map them into clip space, which the origin is the center of monitor. Then we apply the inverse wl_transform of the output to get actual device coordinates.

NDC_coord = wl_transform * proj * image_coord

Additional transformation can happen between projection and wl_transform, for example an additional scaling can be applyed.

Parameters:

width

is the width of the transformed output.

height

is the height pf the transformed output.

 
struct wl_client* tw_launch_client(
    struct wl_display* display,
    const char* path,
    struct tw_subprocess* chld
    )

front end of tw_launch_client_complex

works like tw_launch_client_complex(ec, path, chld, NULL, NULL);

struct wl_client* tw_launch_client_complex(
    struct wl_display* display,
    const char* path,
    struct tw_subprocess* chld,
    int(*)(pid_t, struct tw_subprocess*) fork,
    int(*)(const char*, struct tw_subprocess*) exec
    )

launch wayland client

this function follows the fork-exec routine and creates a new wayland client, setting wayland socket is taking care of and you can optionally set your own fork and exec routine.

The optional fork routine is done after fork() is called. It can be used to setup the post forking procedures for parent and child process.

The optional exec routine need to actually call exec*() and return the non-zero if it fails.

void tw_surface_set_position(struct tw_surface* surface, float x, float y)

dirty the geometry of the surface and subsurfaces.

Compositor should accumulate all the damage of the surface when geometry is dirty.

void tw_surface_dirty_geometry(struct tw_surface* surface)

force dirting the geometry, it would damages all its clip region for the outputs.

void tw_surface_flush_frame(struct tw_surface* surface, uint32_t time_msec)

flushing the view state, clean up the damage and also calls frame signal

void tw_render_context_destroy(struct tw_render_context* ctx)

I think this will simply seat here even if we have a vulkan render context, EGL render context will be compulsory

void tw_render_output_flush_frame(
    struct tw_render_output* output,
    const struct timespec* now
    )

flush frame will send wl_callback::done for the wl_surfaces.

It is enssential to call this at some point after the frame rendering is done as wayland clients reply on this to draw next frame.

void tw_render_output_post_frame(struct tw_render_output* output)

posting a render request to render_output

User may call this upon receiving a need_frame signal to trigger the actual rendering, the render_output would repaint if there is no repainting started already

void tw_drm_display_check_action(
    struct tw_drm_display* output,
    drmModeConnector* conn
    )

check_action takes the hardware event and apply the right action

bool tw_drm_check_gpu_resources(struct tw_drm_gpu* gpu)

the function destroys the output, which is fine, since we either call this function on gpu init fail or destruction.

bool tw_drm_read_properties(
    int fd,
    uint32_t obj_id,
    uint32_t obj_type,
    struct tw_drm_prop_info* info,
    size_t prop_len
    )

scan the properties by binary search, info has to be ordered

bool tw_drm_check_gpu_resources(struct tw_drm_gpu* gpu)

the function destroys the output, which is fine, since we either call this function on gpu init fail or destruction.

    int fd,
    uint32_t obj_id,

    struct tw_drm_prop_info* info,
    size_t prop_len
    )

    struct tw_drm_display* output,
    drmModeConnector* conn

void tw_input_device_attach_emitter(
    struct tw_input_device* device,
    struct tw_input_source* emitter
    )

attach the given input device to an emitter.

multiple input devices can attach to the same emitter, the emitter can also be subscribed by multiple tw_input_sink. This way tw_input_device can handle many-sources-to-many-dests dependency.

    struct wl_buffer* wl_buffer,
    void(*)(void*, struct wl_buffer*) cb,
    void* data
    )

set wl_buffer_release_notify callback here since tw_shm_pool_buffer node ocuppies the user_data of wl_buffer

WL_EXPORT struct wl_buffer* tw_shm_pool_alloc_buffer(
    struct tw_shm_pool* pool,
    size_t width,
    size_t height
    )

/brief allocated a wl_buffer with allocated memory

Do not set the listener or user_data for wl_buffer once it is created like this

WL_EXPORT struct tw_shm_pool* tw_shm_pool_buffer_free(struct wl_buffer* wl_buffer)

declare this buffer is not in use anymore

Returns:

return the tw_shm_pool for resource management purpose

WL_EXPORT void tw_mat3_ortho_proj(
    struct tw_mat3* dst,
    uint32_t width,
    uint32_t height
    )

generating matrix mapping coordinates from image space to clip space.

The mapping procedure goes as following:

(0, 0, width, height) –> (-1, -1, 1, 1) xp = 2*x/width - 1.0 yp = 2*y/height - 1.0

We take the image space coordiantes(in the wl_transformed output), which the origin is the top-left cornor. We need to map them into clip space, which the origin is the center of monitor. Then we apply the inverse wl_transform of the output to get actual device coordinates.

NDC_coord = wl_transform * proj * image_coord

Additional transformation can happen between projection and wl_transform, for example an additional scaling can be applyed.

Parameters:

width

is the width of the transformed output.

height

is the height pf the transformed output.

 
WL_EXPORT struct wl_client* tw_launch_client_complex(
    struct wl_display* display,
    const char* path,
    struct tw_subprocess* chld,
    int(*)(pid_t, struct tw_subprocess*) fork,
    int(*)(const char*, struct tw_subprocess*) exec
    )

launch wayland client

this function follows the fork-exec routine and creates a new wayland client, setting wayland socket is taking care of and you can optionally set your own fork and exec routine.

The optional fork routine is done after fork() is called. It can be used to setup the post forking procedures for parent and child process.

The optional exec routine need to actually call exec*() and return the non-zero if it fails.

WL_EXPORT struct tw_output_device_mode* tw_output_device_match_mode(
    struct tw_output_device* device,
    int w,
    int h,
    int r
    )

used by backends to extract potential matched mode

The algorithm would go through the mode_list searching for the closest mode available(unless there is no modes at all). We return on finding exact mode or the closest mode we can get.

    float y,
    float* gx,
    float* gy
    )

void list_append(list_t* list, list_t* other)

append @other to @list at the end

list_t* list_append_list(list_t* list, list_t* ol)

append a list @other to the @list

So the head of the other is lost, we return the head, you can decide to free it or not

void list_swap(list_t* one, list_t* another)

swap @one and @another

return a new element address for you to copy, since the copy function is usually not efficient for small data type,

(type *) where type is the type of the elem

static int _dhash_search(dhashtab_t* t, const void* key)

cet function guarantee de retourner qqchs

-1: not found in all the entries. data: if hash_empty or eq. Then you need to compare it yourself

void* dhash_search(dhashtab_t* t, const void* key)

NULL: not found, data: found

bool tdbus_server_add_methods(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    const char* obj_path,
    unsigned int n_methods,
    struct tdbus_call_answer* answers
    )

adding methods and register the object path

allocating methods

bool tdbus_readv(
    const struct tdbus_message* msg,
    const char* format,
    va_list ap
    )

reading a message

if you are a client, most likeyly you are reading a signal or a method reply. Given you call them correctly. If you know the argument of message you expect, call directly tdbus_read(v). Use tdbus_read(v) inside @tdbus_read_signal_f or @tdbus_read_reply_f. You can verify the signature of the incoming message with your reader to determine would that be what you expect.

If you are a server, you may expect clients are calling your methods, implement @tdbus_read_call_f for that.

Currently @tdbus_readv and @tdbus_writev only supports basic types.

bool tdbus_writev(struct tdbus_message* message, const char* format, va_list ap)

writing a message

struct tdbus_message* tdbus_call_method(
    const char* dest,
    const char* path,
    const char* interface,
    const char* method,
    tdbus_read_reply_f reply,
    void* user_data
    )

generate a method call message for writing,

use tdbus_write to produce the content of the message

struct tdbus_message* tdbus_reply_method(
    const struct tdbus_message* reply_to,
    const char* err_name
    )

generate a reply message on the server

bool tdbus_send_message_block(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    struct tdbus_message* bus_msg,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply
    )

send message in blocking mode, msg is reused in reply

bool tdbus_send_method_call(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    const char* dest,
    const char* path,
    const char* interface,
    const char* method,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply,
    const char* fmt,
    ...
    )

send message and wait for reply

The message can only be a method call. The function returns false on error occurs.

void tdbus_msg_done_variant(struct tdbus_message_arg* variant)

free the variant (allocated from reading) resource

void tdbus_msg_free_array(void* array, unsigned count, enum tdbus_arg_type type)

convenience function for deallocate array at once, behavior undefined if wrong type is provided

void tdbus_set_nonblock(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    void* data,
    tdbus_add_watch_f addf,
    tdbus_ch_watch_f chf,
    tdbus_rm_watch_f rmf,
    tdbus_add_timeout_f addt,
    tdbus_ch_timeout_f cht,
    tdbus_rm_timeout_f rmt
    )

set tdbus to work in the nonblock mode

dbus mainloop intergration, the watches does not do anything useful, only required for dbus to be non-block.

In the watches, call @tdbus_handle_watch to process the dbus internals.

void tdbus_dispatch_once(struct tdbus* bus)

dispatch the mainloop once, this is an idle run. I cant believe they dont have polling

static DBusHandlerResult tdbus_handle_messages(
    DBusConnection* conn,
    DBusMessage* message,
    void* data
    )

handle client messages.

Handles signal and reply, since it runs before the object path handlers does.

TDBUS_EXPORT void tdbus_dispatch_once(struct tdbus* bus)

dispatch the mainloop once, this is an idle run. I cant believe they dont have polling

void tdbus_msg_done_variant(struct tdbus_message_arg* variant)

free the variant (allocated from reading) resource

void tdbus_msg_free_array(void* array, unsigned count, enum tdbus_arg_type type)

convenience function for deallocate array at once, behavior undefined if wrong type is provided

TDBUS_EXPORT struct tdbus_message* tdbus_call_method(
    const char* dest,
    const char* path,
    const char* interface,
    const char* method,
    tdbus_read_reply_f reply,
    void* user_data
    )

generate a method call message for writing,

use tdbus_write to produce the content of the message

TDBUS_EXPORT struct tdbus_message* tdbus_reply_method(
    const struct tdbus_message* reply_to,
    const char* err_name
    )

generate a reply message on the server

TDBUS_EXPORT bool tdbus_send_message_block(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    struct tdbus_message* bus_msg,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply
    )

send message in blocking mode, msg is reused in reply

TDBUS_EXPORT bool tdbus_send_method_call(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    const char* dest,
    const char* path,
    const char* interface,
    const char* method,
    struct tdbus_reply* reply,
    const char* fmt,
    ...
    )

send message and wait for reply

The message can only be a method call. The function returns false on error occurs.

TDBUS_EXPORT bool tdbus_readv(
    const struct tdbus_message* msg,
    const char* format,
    va_list ap
    )

reading a message

if you are a client, most likeyly you are reading a signal or a method reply. Given you call them correctly. If you know the argument of message you expect, call directly tdbus_read(v). Use tdbus_read(v) inside @tdbus_read_signal_f or @tdbus_read_reply_f. You can verify the signature of the incoming message with your reader to determine would that be what you expect.

If you are a server, you may expect clients are calling your methods, implement @tdbus_read_call_f for that.

Currently @tdbus_readv and @tdbus_writev only supports basic types.

static bool tdbus_write_itr(
    DBusSignatureIter* sitr,
    DBusMessageIter* itr,
    struct tdbus_message_itr* mitr
    )

the signature iter need to be validated

TDBUS_EXPORT bool tdbus_writev(
    struct tdbus_message* tdbus_msg,
    const char* format,
    va_list ap
    )

writing a message

TDBUS_EXPORT bool tdbus_server_add_methods(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    const char* obj_path,
    unsigned int n_methods,
    struct tdbus_call_answer* answers
    )

adding methods and register the object path

allocating methods

TDBUS_EXPORT void tdbus_set_nonblock(
    struct tdbus* bus,
    void* data,
    tdbus_add_watch_f addf,
    tdbus_ch_watch_f chf,
    tdbus_rm_watch_f rmf,
    tdbus_add_timeout_f addt,
    tdbus_ch_timeout_f cht,
    tdbus_rm_timeout_f rmt
    )

set tdbus to work in the nonblock mode

dbus mainloop intergration, the watches does not do anything useful, only required for dbus to be non-block.

In the watches, call @tdbus_handle_watch to process the dbus internals.

int tw_globals_announce(
    struct tw_globals* globals,
    struct wl_registry* wl_registry,
    uint32_t name,
    const char* interface,
    uint32_t version
    )

taking care of common wl_globals like wl_shm, wl_seat, wl_data_device_manager

You would call this function in your wl_registry->globals callback, you try to register the specific globals interests you, then call this function for the rest

bool xdg_app_entry_from_file(const char* path, struct xdg_app_entry* entry)

loading an desktop entry from a xdg desktop file

struct wl_array xdg_apps_gather(void)

gather all the application info on the system

int tw_event_queue_add_source(
    struct tw_event_queue* queue,
    int fd,
    struct tw_event* event,
    uint32_t mask
    )

add directly a epoll fd to event queue

epoll fd are usually stream files, for normal files (except procfs and sysfs), use tw_event_queue_add_file

bool tw_event_queue_remove_source(struct tw_event_queue* queue, int fd)

remove items from event queue

int tw_event_queue_add_file(
    struct tw_event_queue* queue,
    const char* path,
    struct tw_event* e,
    uint32_t mask
    )

add a file to inotify watch system

this adds a inotify fd to event queue, this does not work for sysfs

int tw_event_queue_add_device(
    struct tw_event_queue* queue,
    const char* subsystem,
    const char* devname,
    struct tw_event* e
    )

add a device to udev monitoring system

subsystem shouldn’t be none.

struct udev_device* tw_event_get_udev_device(
    struct tw_event_queue* queue,
    int fd
    )

returns an allocated udev_device

you have the responsibility to free the allocated udev_device by calling udev_device_unref. And you should only call this function with udev event, otherwise the behavior is undefined

bool tw_event_queue_add_idle(struct tw_event_queue* queue, struct tw_event* e)

add the idle task to the queue.

You could have a lot of allocation under one frame. So use this feature carefully. For example, use a cached state to check whether it is necessary to add to this list.

an example of event would be resize event, this event is delegated from a wl_event.

bool tw_gl_stage_init(
    struct tw_gl_stage* stage,
    struct tw_gl_texture* depth,
    struct tw_gl_texture* stencil,
    uint32_t ubuffers,
    ...
    )

init a framebuffer using given textures, if given depth and stencil buffer is the same. Then the texture has to be depth_stencil buffer

struct image_cache image_cache_from_arrays(
    const struct wl_array* handle_array,
    const struct wl_array* str_array,
    void(*)(char output[256], const char*input) convert
    )

loading atlas texture from a list of image paths.

struct image_cache image_cache_from_arrays_filtered(
    const struct wl_array* handle_array,
    const struct wl_array* str_array,
    void(*)(char output[256], const char*input) convert,
    bool(*)(const char*input, void*data) filter,
    void* user_data
    )

loading atlas texture from a list of image paths, with filtering ability

struct image_cache image_cache_from_fd(int fd)

image cache file IO reading

very slow, could be on another thread

void image_cache_to_fd(const struct image_cache* cache, int fd)

image cache file IO writing

very slow, could be on another thread

bool image_load_for_buffer(
    const char* path,
    enum wl_shm_format format,
    int width,
    int height,
    unsigned char* mem
    )

this function loads the image and resize it to given size

struct wl_buffer* tw_shm_pool_alloc_buffer(
    struct tw_shm_pool* pool,
    size_t width,
    size_t height
    )

/brief allocated a wl_buffer with allocated memory

Do not set the listener or user_data for wl_buffer once it is created like this

struct tw_shm_pool* tw_shm_pool_buffer_free(struct wl_buffer* wl_buffer)

declare this buffer is not in use anymore

Returns:

return the tw_shm_pool for resource management purpose

void tw_shm_pool_set_buffer_release_notify(
    struct wl_buffer* wl_buffer,
    void(*)(void*, struct wl_buffer*) cb,
    void* data
    )

set wl_buffer_release_notify callback here since tw_shm_pool_buffer node ocuppies the user_data of wl_buffer

void tw_appsurf_init(
    struct tw_appsurf* app,
    struct wl_surface* surf,
    struct tw_globals* g,
    enum tw_appsurf_type type,
    const uint32_t flags
    )

clean start a new appsurface

void tw_appsurf_init_default(
    struct tw_appsurf* app,
    struct wl_surface* surf,
    struct tw_globals* g
    )

@breif create a default desktop like application

void tw_appsurf_release(struct tw_appsurf* surf)

the universal release function

It releases all the resources but user is responsible for destroy the proxy first before calling this method

void tw_appsurf_request_frame(struct tw_appsurf* surf)

request a frame for the appsurface

You can use this callback to start the animation sequence for the surface, so frame the next draw call, the app will be in animation. You can stop the animation by calling tw_appsurf_end_frame_request. The function is intentioned to be used directly in the frame_callback kick start the animation.

void tw_appsurf_request_frame_event(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    struct tw_app_event* event
    )

request a event to run at next frame.

as compared to idle events, this callback could help reducing the amount of unecessary requests.

void tw_appsurf_frame(struct tw_appsurf* surf, bool anime)

kick off the drawing for the surface

user call this function to start drawing. It triggers the frames untils tw_appsurf_release is called.

void tw_appsurf_resize(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    uint32_t nw,
    uint32_t nh,
    uint32_t ns
    )

start the resize of app surface.

void tw_appsurf_init_egl(struct tw_appsurf* surf, struct tw_egl_env* env)

a helper function if you have egl_env

I do not want to include this but there is a fixed way to allocate wl_egl_window and EGLSurface, even with nuklear

bool tw_shm_buffer_reallocate(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    const struct tw_bbox* geo
    )

we can expose part of shm_buffer implementation for any shm_pool double buffer based implementation

void tw_embeded_impl_app_surface(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    struct tw_appsurf* parent,
    const struct tw_bbox geo
    )

/brief second implementation we provide here is the parent surface

WL_EXPORT void tw_appsurf_init_egl(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    struct tw_egl_env* env
    )

a helper function if you have egl_env

I do not want to include this but there is a fixed way to allocate wl_egl_window and EGLSurface, even with nuklear

    )

    )

WL_EXPORT void tw_appsurf_request_frame(struct tw_appsurf* surf)

request a frame for the appsurface

You can use this callback to start the animation sequence for the surface, so frame the next draw call, the app will be in animation. You can stop the animation by calling tw_appsurf_end_frame_request. The function is intentioned to be used directly in the frame_callback kick start the animation.

WL_EXPORT void tw_appsurf_request_frame_event(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    struct tw_app_event* event
    )

request a event to run at next frame.

as compared to idle events, this callback could help reducing the amount of unecessary requests.

static void shm_wl_buffer_release(void* data, struct wl_buffer* wl_buffer)

smartly release the buffer and pool.

We are waiting for compositor to return all the buffers. There could be cases where we switched to new pool before compositor returns the buffers from previous pool. In that case the previous pool becomes a wild pointer. The pool will eventually be freed here if compositor finally returns the buffer back to us.

WL_EXPORT bool tw_shm_buffer_reallocate(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    const struct tw_bbox* geo
    )

we can expose part of shm_buffer implementation for any shm_pool double buffer based implementation

WL_EXPORT void tw_embeded_impl_app_surface(
    struct tw_appsurf* surf,
    struct tw_appsurf* parent,
    const struct tw_bbox geo
    )

/brief second implementation we provide here is the parent surface

WL_EXPORT int tw_globals_announce(

struct nk_image nk_wl_image_from_buffer(
    unsigned char* pixels,
    struct nk_wl_backend* b,
    unsigned int width,
    unsigned int height,
    unsigned int stride,
    bool take
    )

create an image from malloced pixels (if asked)

The pixels need to be This function takes away the pixel content you have. This function does not add to nuklear backend automatically

struct nk_image* nk_wl_load_image(
    const char* path,
    enum wl_shm_format format,
    struct nk_wl_backend* b
    )

adding a image from path to nuklear backend

struct nk_image* nk_wl_add_image(struct nk_image img, struct nk_wl_backend* b)

adding a image to nuklear backend, backend will now take the ownership of the image

WL_EXPORT struct nk_image nk_wl_image_from_buffer(
    unsigned char* pixels,

    unsigned int width,
    unsigned int height,
    unsigned int stride,
    bool take
    )

The pixels need to be This function takes away the pixel content you have. This function does not add to nuklear backend automatically

Macros¶

#define list_for_each(pos, head, member)

use this one if don’t need to change the link structure

#define list_for_each(pos, head, member)

use this one if don’t need to change the link structure

#define list_for_each_safe(pos, tmp, head, member)

use this one if you are in destructors

#define list_for_each_safe(pos, tmp, head, member)

use this one if you are in destructors

#define vector_for_each(pos, v)

iterator over an array

taken from wl_array, provides a easier way to iterator through a vector

#define vector_for_each(pos, v)

iterator over an array

taken from wl_array, provides a easier way to iterator through a vector
